Posted By: Mudbutt_on (4/2/2010 2:26:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I usually have this out by Turn 4, helps keep the momentum of your goblins as they suddenly become 3/1's, 4/2's and the like. Combined with [Quest for the Goblin Lord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for the Goblin Lord) and a [Goblin Chieftain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftain) or two, and you're set.  
  
For a nice finishing touch, I like to throw on [Tenza, Godo's Maul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tenza, Godo's Maul) to turn it into a 10/8 behemoth. Only thing that can ruin my day is the multitudes of black killspells.
posts.html:
I usually have this out by Turn 4, helps keep the momentum of your goblins as they suddenly become 3/1's, 4/2's and the like. Combined with Quest for the Goblin Lord and a Goblin Chieftain or two, and you're set.

For a nice finishing touch, I like to throw on Tenza, Godo's Maul to turn it into a 10/8 behemoth. Only thing that can ruin my day is the multitudes of black killspells.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Spoonsire (7/13/2010 4:28:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: consider this scenario: you have no untapped creatures and your opponent attacks with a [watchwolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=watchwolf) and a [leatherback baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=leatherback baloth). you responod sacrificing a [mudbutton torchrunner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mudbutton torchrunner) and playing this for 3 mana, blocking and killing the baloth and doing the 3 damage of the torchrunner to the watchwolf, taking no damage yourself. the next turn attack for the win with your pumped goblins and a 7/5. all for 3 mana.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Awesome combo with [Tuktuk the Explorer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tuktuk the Explorer). Use offering ability during opponent's turn, preferably after combat, then attack next turn with two 7/5 creatures.
